isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9800 - CAB TILTING - COMPONENTS

svcsubproc.title: Cab Mounting and Tilt Mechanism
svcsubproc.para: The four point mounting used for the cab incorporates the mobility required for tilting. The system includes the following: cab front mounting hinges ( Figure 87), cab rear latch pads ( Figure 88) and latches ( Figure 89), and cab tilt hydraulic system ( Figure 90).

figure.caption: Figure 87. Front Mounting Hinges and Hinge Brackets

svcsubproc.title: Mounting Hinges
svcsubproc.para: Two front mounting hinges, lower hinge bracket ( Item 4, Figure 87) and upper hinge bracket ( Item 2, Figure 87), which cab lift cylinders ( Item 1, Figure 87) are attached to, support front of cab and permit cab to tilt at this location. The hinges also provide the main disconnect point if the cab must be removed from the chassis. The right hinge provides adjustment to square the cab on the chassis.

svcsubproc.title: Latch Pads and Latches
svcsubproc.para: Besides providing the rear mount for the cab, the two cab rear latch pads ( Figure 88) and latches ( Figure 89) provide a positive spring-loaded latch hook for keeping cab secure to frame.

Positive re-engagement of latch hook is ensured by mechanical spring tension when cab is lowered onto its latch pads. The re-engagement is initiated by an external lever (trigger) against its actuator.

note.para: Keep cab latch assembly lubricated. Use engine oil.
